text: Wall of text incoming...  Sadly, this movie is trash. And I don't say that lightly, because I'm a huge fan of Michael Bay and his work. I loved the first 3 Transformers movies (yes, even the widely panned and hated Revenge of the Fallen), as they had epic CGI, cool robot fights, awesome one-liners, and enough humor to keep one chuckling every so often. But Extinction is a steaming pile of shit. I'm sorry to say it, but it's fucking terrible. I saw it, and words alone can't express how disappointed I am.  It's not Bay's fault, as he did the best he could with the script he was given. Visually, Extinction is gorgeous, but the script is a friggin mess. The story is fragmented with multiple frayed threads and set against a backdrop of expositionary nonsense, the main villain lacks focus and conviction, the human bad guys are laughably cartoonish in their malevolence, and the dialogue is beyond horrendous. Optimus starts the movie damaged and in sore need of repairs, and his near-successful lobotomization at the hands of the human agency hunting him is the only thing that can explain the crappy lines and inane drivel he spouts through the entire film. Gone are the days of "I'll take you all on!" and "You left me no choice, brother...", now replaced instead with (paraphrasing here) "We're not your technology!!!11!!!1!".  I mean, come on! What the fuck?!  Also, the main story arc is complete and utter shit. At no point does the multitude of parallel threads converge in one logical and satisfying conclusion, but remain only tangentially relevant to each other throughout the entire movie. Oh, and the widely-advertised Dinobots? Deux Ex Machina. They appear during the final 15-ish minutes of the film, dropped there by a convenient plot mechanic, and then help the Autobots defeat a cookie-cutter, soulless army of 50-something mass-produced 'Decepticons' (and I use the word lightly, since none of them have any lines or personality).  Laughable.  All I have to say is, for shame, Ehren Kruger, for shame. You could've done so much more with the script. I honestly hope you step up your game for #5, or they get someone else to pen the story. Sadly, the movie is making so much money, it's doubtful Paramount will sack Kruger. Which means the next film in the franchise will also probably turn out no different - a fat, steaming disappointment.  Verdict: skip this one unless you enjoy CGI, or are taking your kid(s) to see it.  P.S. Marky Mark still can't act.

I just don't like how he flew at the end, like he got his flying thing back outta nowhere, that was a WTF thing. There were lots of WTF moments in this movie, stupid nonsense moments. Like when the Autobots decided to invade the ""transformium" place" outta nowhere because they saw Ratchet's head, and then when they got there, they talked to the 'inventor' and Optimus was like "yeah you know what, that was kinda dumb, lets go guys".¬†  Soundtrack was awesome IMO, Steve Jablonsky did a great job. Imagine Dragons was great too.  Story was very confusing for me, and I guess I didn't even pay too much attention to it, I was too busy looking at awesome 3D CGI battles in IMAX for 3 hours. Yes, almost 3 hours of movie. This movie is WAAYY TOO LONG, that isn't a big problem for me, but it can get very exhausting to watch almost 3 hours of movie in the cinema, and that's kinda why I don't even remember character names or plot very well, I'll watch it one more time and try to understand it a bit more. text: I don't get the hate for this movie. I loved the old ones, but I get they lacked substance and were kind of mind-numbing. But this plot has a LOT more to it than previous ones. There's a conflict and mystery, but also a discovery about their existence not being "Fate" but more of an invention by an unknown race of the universe. There's also a neat dynamic between Cade and his daughter Tessa and Prime with Bumblebee and how similar their relationships actually are. With this new storyline, the movie is also genuinely funnier without being dirty all the time, the action is MUCH easier to look at and a lot cooler, the special effects are incredible as always, and you care about every character this time around, especially the autobots. I think this movie was just a BIT too long but there wasn't ever a dull moment like in the action with the last trilogy. I enjoyed this movie a lot more than I thought I would, but the only thing these movies strive for is to be visually appealing and full of awesome, which it does perfectly. Anything more is just a bonus, and this movie was full of bonuses for me.
